intro: Fiedleria arabica, commonly known as the Arabian fiedleria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
